pmSection.title: The Complete Loop
pmSection.body:
Evidence is a professional network where work‚Äînot profiles‚Äîdrives discovery, conversation, collaboration, and opportunity. 

Post work ‚Üí Get discovered ‚Üí Start project conversations ‚Üí Collaborate ‚Üí Unlock opportunities ‚Üí Build reputation.

about.title: What's Broken Today?
about.aboutBody: Across platforms like LinkedIn, portfolios, and repos, builders face fundamental problems: work is scattered, conversations lack context, discovery is pedigree-based, and there's no clear pathway from work to opportunity. Evidence solves this by making work the center of everything.
about.goal: The goal? Create a network where proof-of-work drives discovery, conversation, and opportunity‚Äînot titles, companies, or connections.
industryBullets: Work scattered across GitHub, Drive, Notion, Behance‚Äîno single discoverable surface
No context-rich way to start conversations from a project
Discovery by title/company, not by what you actually built
No pathway from work ‚Üí opportunity (how does a startup find me?)
about.mission: Mission: Build a network where work is the primitive. If someone clicks "Discuss this project", that gives context, removes awkward cold starts, and makes networking about craft‚Äînot small talk.

userSegments: Gen Z builders (18‚Äì25): students, recent grads, early-career designers, devs, creators, indie hackers with projects but low visibility
Founders: hiring for craft-first talent, want signal beyond resumes
Startup recruiters: need fast proof-of-work to evaluate candidates
Mentors: scouting emerging builders to guide and back
userGoals: Show real work visually in one discoverable place
Start context-rich conversations about specific projects
Get discovered for what they built, not where they worked
businessFocus: Make posting work frictionless (social-first, Google/GitHub login)
Enforce video-first proof (‚â•30s) to raise signal quality
Drive work-led discovery and project-centric conversations
Build a proof-of-work reputation layer that compounds over time

clientPreferences.description: The vast majority of Gen Z builders prioritize platforms that showcase real work over traditional resume-based discovery.

topPainPoints.title: Nowhere to Show Real Work Visually
topPainPoints.problem: Work scattered across GitHub, Drive, Notion, Behance. No single discoverable surface where builders can showcase their projects in a media-first way.
topPainPoints.friction: I have 20 projects across 5 platforms. How do I show them all in one place where people can actually find me?

topPainPoints.title: No Context-Rich Way to Start Conversations
topPainPoints.problem: Current platforms offer Like/Comment/DM, but no way to say "I want to talk about THIS build". Conversations start cold, without context.
topPainPoints.friction: I want to discuss someone's Figma prototype, but I can only like it or send a generic DM. There's no "Discuss this project" button.

topPainPoints.title: Hard to Discover Builders by What They Build
topPainPoints.problem: Discovery is pedigree-based (title/company). Proof-of-work is not indexed. You can't search for "people who built fintech apps" or "designers who made AI tools".
topPainPoints.friction: I'm looking for a designer who built a fintech app. LinkedIn shows me people who worked at fintech companies, not people who actually built fintech products.

topPainPoints.title: No Pathway from Work ‚Üí Opportunity
topPainPoints.problem: If I post great work: How does a startup find me? How does a recruiter find me? How does a founder reach me? Hiring/search is pedigree-based, not work-based.
topPainPoints.friction: I built an amazing AI tool, but no one knows about it. How do opportunities find me? There's no bridge between my work and potential collaborators.

topPainPoints.title: Reputation is Broken
topPainPoints.problem: Likes, followers, endorsements don't show credibility. No metric that says: "This person consistently builds thoughtful things". Reputation should be proof-of-work based.
topPainPoints.friction: I have 10K followers but no way to show I actually build quality things. Likes don't equal credibility.

topPainPoints.title: I Want to See Unfinished Stuff
topPainPoints.problem: Unfinished work shows thinking, struggle, process, and authenticity‚Äîbut platforms rarely allow this safely. Builders can't share work-in-progress, ask for help with doubts, or help others while they're still building.
topPainPoints.friction: I want to show my process and get feedback or have my doubts solved while building, but platforms only reward polished, finished work. There's no safe space to share WIP timelines, ask for help, and collaborate during the journey.

proposedSolutions.title: Proof-of-Work Identity
proposedSolutions.whatItDoes: Standard project template: title, demo video (min 30 sec), 200 chars description, tags. Project cards grid on profile‚Äîmedia-first, not text-first. Your profile is your work, not your resume.
proposedSolutions.whyItHelps: Creates a single discoverable surface. All your work in one place, visually organized. No more scattered portfolios across 5 platforms.
proposedSolutions.example: Riya uploads her Figma fintech prototype. It appears as a media card with video demo, tags (Figma, UX, Fintech), and a 200-char description. Her profile is now her work grid.

proposedSolutions.title: Peer Acknowledgements
proposedSolutions.whatItDoes: Instead of likes, peers acknowledge projects with specific tags: "Technically hard", "Great craft", "Thoughtful idea". These acknowledgements build reputation‚Äîproof that others recognize your work quality.
proposedSolutions.whyItHelps: Reputation is proof-of-work based, not follower-based. Acknowledgements show credibility: "This person consistently builds thoughtful things".
proposedSolutions.example: A founder acknowledges Riya's project with "Great craft". This acknowledgement appears on her profile, building her reputation.

proposedSolutions.title: Work-Led Interaction
proposedSolutions.whatItDoes: Every project has a "Discuss this project" button. Clicking it starts a private chat with the project context pinned at the top. Builders can ask for help on specific WIP pieces, get doubts clarified, or offer help to others‚Äîall anchored to real work.
proposedSolutions.whyItHelps: Gives context to conversations instantly. Removes awkward cold starts. Makes networking about craft, not small talk, and creates a safe space for meaningful, help-oriented discussions.
proposedSolutions.example: A builder shares a half-finished dashboard and clicks "Discuss this project" to ask for feedback on the information hierarchy. A designer replies with concrete suggestions, and the conversation stays tied to that exact version of the work.

proposedSolutions.title: Discovery ‚Üí Opportunity
proposedSolutions.whatItDoes: Explore feed shows projects, not people. Search & tag filters (Figma, AI, Fintech, etc.). "Open to collaborate / opportunities" toggle on profile. Discovery is work-led, not pedigree-led.
proposedSolutions.whyItHelps: Builders get discovered by what they build, not where they worked. Founders/recruiters find talent by proof-of-work, not job titles.
proposedSolutions.example: A founder searches "Figma + Fintech". Results show all fintech projects built in Figma. They find Riya's project, click "Discuss", and offer a freelance trial.

northStar.title: üìà North Star Metric
northStar.description: This is the core loop metric. Every discussion represents: work discovered ‚Üí context-rich conversation ‚Üí potential opportunity. It measures the health of our work-first network.
northStar.whyItMatters: More discussions = more opportunities = more value for builders. This directly links to business success (network effects, retention) and user success (getting discovered, hired, collaborated with).

supportingMetrics.businessLink: Higher project density improves search/discovery quality, attracting more recruiters/founders.
supportingMetrics.userLink: Builders with more projects get discovered more often and have higher discussion rates.

supportingMetrics.businessLink: Quality signals reduce noise, making the platform more valuable for talent discovery.
supportingMetrics.userLink: Acknowledgements build reputation, leading to more discussions and opportunities.

supportingMetrics.description: Measures conversation quality and relationship building. High repeat rate = strong network effects.
supportingMetrics.businessLink: Repeat conversations indicate platform stickiness and long-term value creation.

launchThesis.title: üöÄ Launch Thesis
launchThesis.tagline: "Stop writing resumes. Show what you built."
launchThesis.description: Evidence launches with a clear value proposition: work-first discovery beats pedigree-based networking. We're not another LinkedIn‚Äîwe're the network where builders get discovered by what they build, not where they worked.

channels.description: Partner with 5-10 major hackathons (MLH, Devpost, local university hackathons). Offer: "Submit your project on Evidence for a chance to be featured." Target: 2,000-3,000 builders from hackathons.
Recruit 20-30 campus ambassadors at top CS/Design schools. Give them early access, featured profiles, and referral rewards. Target: 1,500-2,000 builders via campus network.
Engage with Indie Hackers, Product Hunt makers, Figma community, GitHub trending. Share case studies of builders who got opportunities via Evidence. Target: 2,000-3,000 builders.

Invite 100-200 founders and startup recruiters to join first. They get early access to discover talent. This creates demand-side pull. Target: 1,500-2,000 builders (they invite builders they want to hire).

loops.name: Featured Projects
loops.description: Weekly featured projects for early adopters. Featured builders share their feature ‚Üí social proof ‚Üí more signups.

loops.name: Themed Build Weeks
loops.description: AI Week, Design Week, Fintech Week. Builders submit relevant projects ‚Üí community engagement ‚Üí viral loops within communities.

loops.name: Acknowledgement Notifications
loops.description: When someone acknowledges your project, you get notified. You visit Evidence ‚Üí see other projects ‚Üí acknowledge ‚Üí network effect.

whatsNotIncluded.title: What's NOT Included (By Design)
items: No feed, likes, followers (work-first, not social-first)
No resume/experience section (profile is your work grid)
No public comments (private project discussions only)
No generic DMs (all conversations tied to projects)

productEvolution.title: Product Evolution (6‚Äì12 months)
productEvolution.description: How Evidence evolves to maintain growth and value

features.description: Show process, not just finished work. Builders can share "building in public" updates. Increases engagement and authenticity.
Expand beyond private chats. Allow public Q&A on projects. Builds community and helps others learn.
Algorithmic credibility metric based on acknowledgements, discussion quality, project views. Helps surface top builders.
Let builders curate their best work into themed collections (e.g., "My Fintech Projects", "AI Experiments").
Special accounts for recruiters/founders with verified badges. Builders can filter to see verified opportunities.
Filters by tech stack, project type, location, availability. Saved searches for recruiters.
Built-in tools for builders to find collaborators, start projects together, showcase team work.
GitHub integration (auto-import repos), Figma plugin, Notion integration. Lower friction for project uploads.

monetizationPathway.title: Monetization Pathway (No UX Harm)
monetizationPathway.principle: Builders never pay. Companies pay to discover.

strategies.description: Free: Basic search (10 searches/month). Pro ($99/month): Unlimited searches, advanced filters, saved searches, priority support. Enterprise ($499/month): API access, bulk search, custom integrations.
strategies.uxImpact: Zero impact on builders. Only affects recruiters/founders who want premium discovery tools.

strategies.description: Hackathons/events can sponsor featured project sections. Builders get featured for free (hackathons pay). Optional: Builders can pay $10/month for "Featured" badge on their profile (purely optional, no pressure).
strategies.uxImpact: Minimal. Featured placements are clearly marked. Optional badges don't affect core functionality.

strategies.description: Builders can optionally verify identity/credentials for $5/month. Purely optional‚Äîdoesn't affect discovery or discussions.
strategies.uxImpact: None. Completely optional, doesn't gate any features.

strategies.description: Companies pay $2,000-5,000/month for private talent pools, custom search, bulk messaging (with builder consent), analytics.
strategies.uxImpact: Positive. Builders get more opportunities. Companies get better discovery tools. Win-win.

monetizationPathway.revenueProjection: Year 1: $50K-100K MRR (500-1,000 paying recruiters/founders). Year 2: $200K-500K MRR (network effects + enterprise).
